translation: The Vedas deal with the three attributes; be thou above these three attributes. O Arjuna, free yourself from the pairs of opposites and ever remain in the quality of Sattva, freed from acquisition and preservation, and be established in the Self.
commentary: 2.45 Three attributes deal with the three attributes? Vedas the Vedas? Nistraigunyah without these three attributes? Be be? Arjuna O Arjuna nirdvandvah free from the pairs of opposites? ever remaining in the Sattva (goodness)? Niryogkshemah free from (the thought of) acisition and preservation? Atmavan established in the Self.Commentary Guna means attribute or ality. It is substance
